Thomas.Bruenjes@... wrote:
> 
> Hallo,
> I want to write the daily testresults and logfiles from JUnit and HttpUnit
> into a testcase database.
> Thats means run tests, write log, connect database. But in Eclipse run the
> tests twice, because the JUnit plugin gets the suite and
> let them run. When I choice "Run as Application" in Eclipse the tests run
> once, but I loose the GUI-Information from JUnit-Plugin.
> How do I get the TestResult object from Testrunner to participate the
> results that I need to archive? Overload run (but how an where)? Wrap suite
> (but how an where)?

One way to achieve this is to use Ant. In chapter 7 of JUnit Recipes you 
can find examples of formatting test results. You could write your own 
formatter that formats results (including standard out and standard 
error content) into something suitable for storing in a database, then 
perform the INSERT at the end of the test run. I've never tried it, 
myself, but it ought to work.

If you want to hook into Eclipse, you'd need to register a test run 
listener to write the results to the database after each run. I don't 
remember just now whether the test run listener has access to the 
TestResult instance, but it has access to each failure and error as it 
occurs.

Good luck.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
